abstract.text: Scales an 8-bit planar image to fit a destination buffer.

inlineContent.text: A pointer to a vImage buffer structure that contains the source image.
A pointer to the destination vImage buffer structure. Youâ€™re responsible for filling out the
, and

fields of this structure and for allocating a data buffer of the appropriate size. On return, the data buffer this structure points to contains the destination image data. When you no longer need the data buffer, deallocate the memory to prevent memory leaks.
A pointer to a temporary buffer. If you pass

, the function allocates the buffer and then deallocates it before returning. Alternatively, you can allocate the buffer yourself, in which case youâ€™re responsible for deallocating it when you no longer need it.
The options to use when applying the scale.
If you want vImage to use a higher quality but a slower resampling filter, set the
flag.

The relative dimensions of the source image and the destination buffer determine the scaling factors. The function supports nonuniform scaling â€” that is, the horizontal and vertical ratios can be different.
To avoid artifacts in high-frequency regions of the image, supply image data thatâ€™s nonpremultiplied or that has a constant alpha over the entire image.
This function doesnâ€™t work in place â€” that is, the source and destination buffers must point to different memory.

abstract.text: Make large-scale mathematical computations and image calculations, optimized for high performance and low energy consumption.
Reflect, shear, rotate, and scale image buffers using vImage.
A flag that disables vImage internal tiling routines.
A flag that uses a higher-quality, slower resampling filter for geometry operations.
A flag that restricts the operation to red, green, and blue channels only.
The vImage function completed without error.
Improve your appâ€™s performance by converting image buffer formats from interleaved to planar.

Scales a signed 16-bit planar image to fit a destination buffer.
Scales an unsigned 16-bit planar image to fit a destination buffer.
Scales an 8-bit planar image to fit a destination buffer.
Scales a 32-bit planar image to fit a destination buffer.

A pointer for accessing data of a specific type.
A raw pointer for accessing and manipulating untyped data.
